ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Understanding of upcoming modern technologies and their public applications
I developed some general knowledge about the development of various technologies. I developed my presentation skills as I had to research and present for a final presentation.
I learned about modern technologies and their impact on the world.
I learned a lot about the modern day technology
I learned a little bit about the history of technology and how itll lead to our future.
understood the intersection of public policy and modern tech

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Find more opportunities for students to talk to each other

The material of the course was pretty interesting. Also, the guest lectures and field trips were cool. I would say that it could be improved by making it more interactive, perhaps adding a dimension. In that way, there would be more discussion.
Could involve more in class discussions.
Its very organized and great professor
The discussions werent as engaging as I thought but there were interesting topics.
latter half was more interesting than first half, could do with more guest speakers

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, the course load isn't too bad and the topics are interesting enough.
Yes, it is a interested course and good to balance out your schedule.
I would because it has many intriguing topics
